meanings.sent1: She tried to subtilize her painting by adding delicate details.
meanings.sent2: He always subtilizes his cooking by using fresh herbs and spices.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to subtilize the dish by garnishing it with edible flowers.
meanings.sent4: Her elegant dress was subtilized with intricate lace patterns.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes subtilized the portrait, capturing every emotion.

meanings.definition: Make subtle distinctions in thought or language.
meanings.sent1: It is important to subtilize between right and wrong.
meanings.sent2: She can subtilize the different shades of blue in the painting.
meanings.sent3: The detective had to subtilize the suspect's alibi to solve the case.
meanings.sent4: His ability to subtilize in poetry made his verses truly captivating.
meanings.sent5: The professor could subtilize the nuances of the ancient text with ease.
